name: calcification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ]
  medical
  specialized a gradual increase in the amount of calcium in body tissue, sometimes as a response to injury, causing the tissue to harden, or an area of such tissue: We frequently found the calcification of ligaments and muscle attachments. Arterial walls may develop calcifications, which reduce the ability of the vessels to transport blood adequately.
[ U ] the process in which ideas, systems, methods, etc. become fixed and difficult to change over a period of time: It is very difficult to prevent the calcification of public opinion. The calcification of the technology comes at the end of a long period of innovation.
